decks.notes: This deck focuses on utilizing Cloudpost lands along with mana ramp cards to quickly generate a large amount of mana to cast powerful spells and creatures such as Karn, the Great Creator, and Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger. It also includes utility cards like Pithing Needle and Warping Wail to disrupt opponents' strategies. The deck aims to overwhelm opponents with its ramping abilities and powerful threats to secure a victory.

This deck aims to utilize the Aluren combo to effectively and efficiently control the board and disrupt opponents while generating value through card advantage and creature recursion. By utilizing cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Oko, Thief of Crowns alongside powerful green creatures like Ice-Fang Coatl and Noble Hierarch, the deck is able to both protect its combo pieces and outvalue opponents. With a toolbox of creatures like Recruiter of the Guard and versatile removal spells like Swords to Plowshares, the deck can adapt to different matchups and win through incremental advantage.

The deck focuses on using Lands to control the opponent's strategy, utilizing cards like Crop Rotation and Wasteland to disrupt their mana base. It also includes powerful planeswalkers like Oko, Thief of Crowns to control the battlefield, while cards like Thoughtseize and Brainstorm help to manipulate the opponent's hand and draw. The deck also has a strong graveyard synergy with Life from the Loam and Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath. Overall, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's plans while generating incremental value to eventually overpower them.

The primary focus of this deck is to disrupt opponents with a combination of removal spells and counter magic, while also deploying threats such as Oko, Thief of Crowns and Jolrael, Mwonvuli Recluse to apply pressure and generate card advantage. The deck aims to control the board in the early game before transitioning into a more aggressive midrange strategy with powerful threats like Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath and Leovold, Emissary of Trest. The mana base is carefully constructed to support the deck's color requirements and maximize consistency in casting its spells.

The key concept of this deck is to maintain a highly efficient tempo by using disruptive spells and creatures to control the board while also applying pressure through aggressive creatures like Delver of Secrets and Tarmogoyf. By utilizing cards like Oko, Thief of Crowns and Daze, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan and keep them on the back foot. The deck also includes powerful cards like Klothys, God of Destiny to provide additional value and resilience in longer games. Overall, the deck is designed to be proactive, disruptive, and versatile in its approach to winning games.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize aggressive creatures like Delver of Secrets and Dreadhorde Arcanist while disrupting the opponent's game plan with countermagic like Force of Will and Spell Pierce. The deck also aims to control the board with removal spells such as Lightning Bolt and Wasteland. Oko, Thief of Crowns provides additional disruption and threats, while cards like Brainstorm and Ponder help dig for key pieces. The deck's mana base allows for flexibility and consistency in casting spells, with a focus on tempo and pressure to overwhelm the opponent quickly.

The deck focuses on assembling the Dark Depths combo as quickly as possible, using cards like Crop Rotation, Sylvan Scrying, and Elvish Reclaimer to find the required pieces. Vampire Hexmage and Thespian's Stage can then be used to create a 20/20 Marit Lage token in a single turn. The deck also includes disruption in the form of hand disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Duress, as well as Pithing Needle and Not of This World to protect the combo. Overall, the deck aims to win the game through the powerful Dark Depths combo while disrupting the opponent's game plan.

The main concept of this Doomsday combo deck is to efficiently dig through the deck with cantrips like Brainstorm, Ponder, and Preordain to find the Doomsday card. Once Doomsday is cast, the player will pile their deck in a way that allows them to win the game on the spot, usually by stacking their library with Thassa's Oracle on top. The deck also contains disruption in the form of Force of Will, Daze, and Duress to protect the combo and interact with the opponent's game plan.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly assemble a board full of Elves and utilize Glimpse of Nature and Green Sun's Zenith to generate card advantage and create explosive turns. By using cards like Heritage Druid and Nettle Sentinel to generate mana, the deck can easily cast powerful cards like Natural Order to put Craterhoof Behemoth into play and overwhelm the opponent with a massive attack. The deck also includes utility cards like Wirewood Symbiote and Quirion Ranger to help bounce creatures and reuse their abilities, creating a versatile and powerful combo strategy.

The key concept of this deck is to quickly fill the graveyard with creatures using cards like Hedron Crab, Stitcher's Supplier, and Careful Study, to enable the combo of casting Hogaak, Arisen Necropolis and Vengevine from the graveyard. The deck utilizes Altar of Dementia to sacrifice creatures for value and to trigger Bridge from Below. By creating a critical mass of creatures in the graveyard, the deck can overwhelm the opponent with relentless attacks and strong synergy between the various combo pieces.

The focus of this deck is to control the game by utilizing lands as the main resource. It aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan by utilizing cards like Wasteland, Rishadan Port, and Ghost Quarter to disrupt their mana base. It also has a combo potential with Dark Depths and Thespian's Stage to create a powerful 20/20 creature. The deck also has access to powerful planeswalkers like Oko, Thief of Crowns and Klothys, God of Destiny, along with other control elements like Punishing Fire and The Tabernacle at Pendrell Vale.

The deck focuses on assembling the Painter's Servant and Grindstone combo to mill the opponent's library. The deck includes tools like Goblin Welder, Emry, Lurker of the Loch, and Goblin Engineer to recur key pieces and control the game. Additionally, the deck features disruption elements like Dack Fayden, Pyroblast, and Blood Moon to disrupt the opponent's strategy. The inclusion of artifacts like Mox Opal, Lion's Eye Diamond, and Lotus Petal allow for explosive plays, while cards like Ensnaring Bridge and Brazen Borrower provide additional protection and versatility.

This deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with powerful creatures using cards like Entomb and Dark Ritual, then bringing them back into play with spells like Animate Dead and Reanimate. It also includes disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Duress to protect the combo and control the opponent's hand. The goal is to reanimate high-impact creatures like Grave Titan, Iona, Shield of Emeria, Sphinx of the Steel Wind, Ashen Rider, and Griselbrand to overwhelm the opponent and win the game.

The deck focuses on quickly ramping up mana and putting powerful creatures into play for free using the Show and Tell combo. By combining cards like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn and Phyrexian Dreadnought with Omniscience, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with powerful, game-winning threats. It also includes disruptive elements like Force of Will, Stifle, and Spell Pierce to protect its combos and disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck's goal is to get ahead on board quickly and close out the game before the opponent has a chance to recover.

The deck focuses on utilizing tempo and disruption to control the game while applying pressure with aggressive creatures. It aims to quickly deploy threats while using countermagic and taxing effects to disrupt the opponent's strategy. The combination of efficient creatures with disruptive elements like Force of Will, Spirit of the Labyrinth, and Spell Queller allows the deck to maintain a proactive game plan while disrupting the opponent's plan. The inclusion of Aether Vial helps to cheat creatures into play, enabling fast and powerful starts to overwhelm the opponent.

The deck focuses on utilizing efficient creatures like Delver of Secrets and Sprite Dragon, backed up by powerful spells like Force of Will and Lightning Bolt to quickly pressure the opponent. It also includes disruptive elements like Wasteland and Daze to slow down the opponent's game plan. The deck aims to maintain aggressive pressure while disrupting the opponent's strategy, making strategic use of cards like Oko, Thief of Crowns and Pyroblast for additional versatility and protection. Additionally, the inclusion of cards like Arcum's Astrolabe and Brainstorm provides card advantage and deck filtering to maintain consistency.
